reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dominique Colonna is set just outside of Corte on the Gorge de Restonica. The hotel looks like a standard 2-story motel on the outside, but our second story room, with a balcony overlooking the river gorge, was newly remodeled and filled with welcome conveniences...a bathtub! (instead of a tiny shower), a minibar refrigerator, flat screen TV with (gasp!) English speaking CNN, a wall safe and L’Occitane toiletries. Dinner was a convenient walk across the parking lot to their Auberge de la Restonica restaurant. We had one of our best meals here...a trio of scallops, sea bass and shrimp in a ginger sauce and a duck breast that was outstanding, finished with a chestnut sundae.
reviews.title: Beautiful rest along the river

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next day began coolly with an excellent breakfast sitting outside along the very dry river bed. We began the challenging drive up along the beautiful Restonica gorge road and luckily the traffic wasn’t bad going in/up. But, the road is extremely narrow with sharp rocky outcroppings with few pull-outs and no guardrails. When you came upon another car, one frequently would have to back up until the other could pass. I’d thought we could hike through this area, but the hikes looked too challenging for us so it turned into a car drive.
reviews.title: overpriced

reviews.text: By 11:30am, it was already very hot when we came back to the university town of Corte. ( I thought it was supposed to be cooler in the mountains....still in the mid-80’s and sunny) We hiked up to the Haut Ville where the Citadel and it’s museum were located. The museum was pretty boring, but it did have a toilet and a comfortable chair for a short nap....worth the admission. Much more interesting was walking further up to the Eagles’ Nest castle with outstanding views of the surrounding mountains. On the way back down, I was feeling punky....tired and hot, so we stopped for dessert at Casanova Patisserie on the main street.
reviews.title: Top hotel in Corsica

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At this point, we should’ve gone back to our hotel and enjoyed their beautiful setting in the forested mountains from their lovely outdoor pool deck. But no, instead we pushed on to Omessa to visit a cultural center with artisans at work that I had read about. Couldn’t find it in the town and I tried asking a couple of old ladies sitting on their porch where it was. The only thing I could make out from their gestures was that it was somewhere outside of town. So, we drove some more and I asked a guy for directions. He went on and on in fervent French, gesturing again that it was somewhere “out there”, until at the very end he said it was “Ferme”. (closed) “Ferme?” I asked, and when he replied again, I got that it had burned to the ground. Why hadn’t they told me that in the first place instead of telling me how to get there! Gotta ask the right questions, I guess.
reviews.title: Over-rated and over-priced

reviews.text: On the way back, we stopped and checked out another pretty (from afar) hillside town, Soveria. Nope, kinda scary looking and definitely not a welcome tourists vibe. So, by the time we returned to our restorative, tranquil setting around the pool, the sun was starting to set behind the mountains and the water felt too cool to go in. We ate our picnic dinner on our balcony, under an almost full moon, and the glow from our maglite flashlight.
reviews.title: Not worth the €'s

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Dominique Colonna in September 2012 in a room overlooking the garden and river. The room was very nice, especially the bathroom. In the evening candles were lit in the garden which looked very prettty though it was too cold to sit out. The river is beautiful and my best experience was bathing alone in one of the natural river pools. There is also a small swimming pool if you prefer. There is a pleasant bar which serves drinks in the evening. The only disadvantage in my view is that there is no restaurant. There is an auberge opposite but we weren't very enthusuastic about it - OK for one night . The hotel is about 2 km from Corte town centre. We were happy to walk this but had to eat early in order to be back before dark. You could drive but parking isn't easy. One solution is to buy a 'picnic' in town and eat it on you balcony overlooking the river.
reviews.title: beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights there and were very satisfied : staff were friendly and helping, room clean, big with a wonderful bathroom, stunning view on the garden and the river, which had a lot of water after some big rainy days. River was too chill to enjoy the bath, but nevertheless the water is so clear, you could not help trying ! Good swimming pool in the hotel too, with towels provided at the front desk. If you do not mind hearing the river (quite a noise but regular and undisturbing), you can enjoy some peaceful moments there, on the terrace overlooking the waters, under the big trees. We ate at the nearby restaurant and the food and wines were ok, even if the dining room is big and lacks privacy. We will certainly go back there.
reviews.title: A GREAT PLACE TO STAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my girlfriend, and in some ways this is truly a luxury hotel. The location by the gorge, and the private spot for cooling down in the river is just amazing. Also how they have designed the garden, and the furniture selection gives it a feel of luxury.
reviews.title: Amazing location, luxury outdoor and good breakfast
The place to be in Corte
reviews.text: The breakfast is good, and also the seating outside by the river. A step up would be to provide freshly squeezed juices and proper coffee. Service was good, but a few more staff would lift the impression.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main drawback is an important one, and that was that the beds were of bad quality and way to hard. Besides cleanliness in an hotel, the beds are the most important. Maybe it was only room 112.
reviews.title: Lovely getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros.... Excellent staff (we had an issue downloading details for our subsequent places to stay and staff were so helpful in getting us access to a PC we needed and printing), great location by river, nice bathroom, nice to sit out in evening with candle light. They kindly gave us a room upgrade for our honeymoon.
reviews.title: Nice location,excellent staff

reviews.text: Cons... Bedroom furniture is a bit dated, breakfast is expensive (we took coffee only on our balcony).
reviews.title: ou can see the other person on the toilet

reviews.text: this hotel is situated just outside the town of Corte, beautiful view, the river flows almost under your feet, but the noise is too much for us while sleeping. we like to have at least a window or something open during the night for ventilation, in this case you must open the sliding door, because there are no windows in the room.
reviews.title: Tranquility in the Restonica Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The personnel is friendly and helpful. The room is very modern but simply furnished, the bathroom has a very strange aspect : there is a kind of milk glass between the room and the bathroom. But the glass is not milky enough : you can see the other person on the toilet! Also, it is not possible to place the shampoo anywhere in the shower (there is no ledge). After a shower, the mirror is completely fogged. Some air circulation in the bathroom or some lamps at the top of the mirror can help this. Another weird thing : in order to get hot water, for example to wash your hands, you must open the tap to cold water, then open the tap further to a strong stream and then, when you open the tap even further, you get hot water (still strong stream). Talk about waste. There is also something in the bathroom to avoid waste : a nice little lamp lights up, when you enter the bathroom at night. For us, it was exactly enough to do our nightly business!
reviews.title: Don't count on dining in the auberge next door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel offers free wifi, even in the room, but no videos and no Skype are possible. The hotel offers a nice breakfast, but for that substantial price, we would expect sufficient healthy bread.
reviews.title: Great Place, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we really liked this hotel. We had a nice room with a great view. The staff were helpful and friendly. We stayed here end of April 2011 - off season for Corsica, so the place was quiet, and we thought it represented good value for money.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a river view room with a balcony. The room was a reasonable size. The bedroom part was clean, tidy and well maintained, but the decor was dated (see pics); the bathroom part looked like it had just been refurbished, and was like I’d expect in a 5 star hotel. The thing that really made it was sitting on the balcony looking over the river.
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel with a lovely pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a nice meal at the restaurant next to the hotel. Breakfast was good too- continental, including meats and cheeses.
reviews.title: A relaxing retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other points: the hotel had free wifi, and a swimming pool. Parking was no problem.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in picture perfect location

reviews.text: Riverside setting was lovely, and Corte a scenic town. Neighbouring auberge was great for food.
reviews.title: A nice place to rest
